results.title: Bali: island of magic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Bali is one of the many Indonesian islands, but it differs from the other Muslim islands in that the people are mainly Hindu, with some Buddhists and an underlying interest in nature worship and even roots of ancient nature worship. Shows the daily life of the Balinese, which is governed by a voluntary village council, the farming and fishing, the market and the monkey dance. Narrated by Roger Climpson. No other credits available.

results.title: Sumatra: island of rice and rubber
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”
Scenes of life in Sumatra, one of the many islands of Indonesia. Shows the agricultural development and methods used by the rural population. Village life style and customs are also seen.

results.title: Java: island of culture
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Illustrates the traditional Javanese arts of wood carving, painting, Batik dyeing, Wayang Kulit and Wayang Wong theatre as they are today, and briefly tours some of the ancient temples of the Island. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: This land has cared for our ancestors for generations and now it’s our turn to care for it. We need to take responsibility. This story is about Alisha’s personal connection with the land.
results.title_for_label: This is a story about the land we live on

results.title: Behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Tim Kanoa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six Indigenous Youth Leadership Programme scholars were invited to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI in June 2007. Here is a glimpse behind the scenes of the workshop and interviews with the participants on their experience.

results.title: A Nana fish
results.creator_credit: Mullie Watson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Originally from Cherbourg, Mullie Watson tells of his fond memories of his nan, about the day they went fishing together and how an owl became his totem.
